name: ext_R4B_ConceptMap_group
title: Cross-version Extension for R4B.ConceptMap.group for use in FHIR R2
description: This cross-version extension represents ConceptMap.group from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ConceptMap|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R2.

element.definition: A group of mappings that all have the same source and target system.
element.comment: `ConceptMap.group` has no related element in R2:ConceptMap

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: An absolute URI that identifies the source system where the concepts to be mapped are defined.

element.short: relatedto | equivalent | equal | wider | subsumes | narrower | specializes | inexact | unmatched | disjoint
element.definition: The equivalence between the source and target concepts (counting for the dependencies and products). The equivalence is read from target to source (e.g. the target is 'wider' than the source).
element.comment: `ConceptMap.group` has no related element in R2:ConceptMap
element.isModifierReason: Some of the values mean that there is no mapping from the source to the target, particularly 'disjoint', and the mapping cannot be interpreted without knowing this value as it could mean the elements are equivalent, totally mismatched or anything in between

element.short: Other concepts that this mapping also produces
element.definition: A set of additional outcomes from this mapping to other elements. To properly execute this mapping, the specified element must be mapped to some data element or source that is in context. The mapping may still be useful without a place for the additional data elements, but the equivalence cannot be relied on.

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.short: What to do when there is no mapping for the source concept
element.definition: What to do when there is no mapping for the source concept. "Unmapped" does not include codes that are unmatched, and the unmapped element is ignored in a code is specified to have equivalence = unmatched.
element.comment: `ConceptMap.group` has no related element in R2:ConceptMap

element.definition: Defines which action to take if there is no match for the source concept in the target system designated for the group. element.short: relatedto | equivalent | equal | wider | subsumes | narrower | specializes | inexact | unmatched | disjoint
element.definition: The equivalence between the source and target concepts (counting for the dependencies and products). The equivalence is read from target to source (e.g. the target is 'wider' than the source).
element.comment: `ConceptMap.group` has no related element in R2:ConceptMap
element.isModifierReason: Some of the values mean that there is no mapping from the source to the target, particularly 'disjoint', and the mapping cannot be interpreted without knowing this value as it could mean the elements are equivalent, totally mismatched or anything in between
